title: Automated Google Drive Remounting Failsafe
excerpt: Implemented a Python-based failsafe system in the Central Hub to monitor and automatically remount Google Drive, queueing commands until availability is restored.
author: Codem
content:
Project Update: Automated Google Drive Remounting

I noticed that every now and again my PC would dismount the Google Drive, often due to sleeping processes or network instability. This was a critical issue, as a remote system cannot afford unexpected failures.

The Solution Design

To address this, I implemented a robust failsafe within the Codem Central Hub. The core solution utilizes the existing Google Drive remounting launch.bat and executable in program files.

Python Failsafe Logic

The main logic resides in main.py, which actively checks the availability of the G Drive. If the drive is unavailable, the system does not fail; instead, all queued commands are carefully recorded and stored.

Remounting is handled by a specialized failsafe script, drive_mount.py, which forces the remount. Once successful, the recorded command queue is safely processed.

This system ensures that the Central Hub maintains operational reliability even when facing intermittent network or system disruptions. You can check out my portfolio to see more projects like this.
